Description: Fragment of weft-faced plain weave, undyed/cream, wool cloth with tapestry (single warp threads) roundel; Roundel in blue-purple wool and undyed linen; Design in roundel with scattered, stylised vegetable forms arranged symmetrically around two axes, wave border; On the same fragment part of the edge of a tapestry band; Warp: S spun wool, c.8tpc; Weft: S spun wool, c.22tpc in plain areas and c.42tpc in tapestry, soumak outlining in S spun linen; Edges: cut or ragged
Curator's comments: Unreg 82; Previously in cupboard P and plan chest in Students' Room; Edges cut post excavation; Woven as part of a larger, mainly cream wool textile; Probably a tunic; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (15.5.1991)
